item.title: Kernel prepatch 6.13-rc6
item.description:
Linus has released 6.13-rc6 for testing.

So we had a slight pickup in commits this last week, but as expected and hoped for, things were still pretty quiet. About twice as many commits as the holiday week, but that's still not all that many.

I expect things will start becoming more normal now that people are back from the holidays and are starting to recover and wake up from their food comas.

item.title: FireScam Android Malware Poses as Telegram Premium to Steal Data and Control Devices
item.description:
An Android information stealing malware named FireScam has been found masquerading as a premium version of the Telegram messaging app to steal data and maintain persistent remote control over compromised devices.
"Disguised as a fake 'Telegram Premium' app, it is distributed through a GitHub.io-hosted phishing site that impersonates RuStore – a popular app store in the Russian Federation,"

item.title: Cybercriminals Target Ethereum Developers with Fake Hardhat npm Packages
item.description:
Cybersecurity researchers have revealed several malicious packages on the npm registry that have been found impersonating the Nomic Foundation's Hardhat tool in order to steal sensitive data from developer systems.

item.title: Intel Touch Host Controller Drivers Nearing The Mainline Linux Kernel
